Welcome to Team Project’s documentation!¶

Flask Application¶

The backend Flask app for the Resturant Management System.

Authentication Class¶

The main authentication class used for API token validation, logging in and auth token exchanges.

Important to note that there aren’t inherent security features built into this class as it is designed to be called by API handlers. Python also doesn’t have private methods so there isn’t much point designing code to prevent access tokens being generate out of sequence as the method can be called anyway

class frameworks.authentication.auth.authentication(token, secret)¶

The constructor for the authentication class.

A valid API key and secret (here named token instead of key) need to be provided. These are used to authenticate API requests from a client.

authenticateRequest(access_tok, uid, level)¶

Takes provided API creds and ensures the user has been previously authenticated.

Parameters:
  • access_tok – should have been previously issued at a valid login
  • uid – the user ID we are expecting to log in
  • level – the permissions level of the resource (int)
Returns:

int with HTTP status code

401 - authentication not completed/expired

403 - not permitted for given level

404 - something is not correct (couldn’t find the user)

authenticateUser(username, password)¶

User authentication for waiter, kitchen staff or manager.

Parameters:
  • username – Valid username
  • password – Valid password
Returns:

False on error or userID on success.
generateAccessToken(uid)¶

Generates an access token that can be used to authenticate API requests. Needs to be provided to authenticateRequest

Parameters:uid – a valid user ID
Returns:Access token

Customer Class¶

class frameworks.customer.customer.customer¶

Object representation of a customer.

Provides various helper methods. Exclusivly used in order class.

createCustomer(name, email)¶

Allows creation of a new customer.

Parameters:
  • name – Customer’s name
  • email – Customer’ email
Returns:

Customer’s ID
getCustomer(customerID)¶

Gets customer data.

Parameters:customerID – Customer’s ID
Returns:dict of customer data
locateCustomer(email)¶

Checks whether a customer already exists for supplied parameters.

Parameters:email – Email to check for existing customer’s with.
Returns:Customer ID for existing customer
Returns:False if no customer found
Raises:Error on duplicate customers

Database Class¶

class frameworks.database.db.db¶

Encapsulation of database connection.

Creates a new connection upon instantiation and closes the connection upon destruction. Whilst you’re unlikely to need to access the class more than once you need to keep it in scope otherwise it will be auto-destructed by Python.

Example useage:

self.__databaseClass = db()
self.__connectionObject = databaseClass.getInstance()
getInstance()¶

Getter for connection instance.

Returns:PyMySQL connection object

ID Class¶

class frameworks.idGenerator.id.id¶

Wrapper for cuid.

getID(prefix)¶

Wrapper for cuid with custom prefix.

Parameters:prefix – Prefix to append CUID ID with
Returns:unique ID string
